Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Undergraduate Studies Dean's Office

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: IDS 3933, Junior standing, and Interdisciplinary Studies major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student exposition of coursework demonstrating the understanding of interdisciplinary approaches and successful synthesis of interdisciplinary studies, applied to the course of study and academic/career goals.

IDS4204C - Advanced Topics on Energy and.name: IDS4204C - Advanced Topics on Energy and Sustainability

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Acceptance into the Energy and Sustainability Minor, Senior standing and Completion of GEP or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Contemporary topics in energy and sustainability. Seminars and lectures from industry, academia, government, and UCF speakers. Students are required to work on individual or team assignments, research projects, and present their work in the format of mini seminars.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science Dean's Office

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Senior Seminar is the capstone course for General Studies, enabling students to integrate undergraduate experiences, prepare professional engagement, and produce a culminating project.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To develop a foundation in qualitative interdisciplinary research methods, students will apply concepts in a research proposal project within their areas of study.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ENC 1102, Junior standing, Interdisciplinary Studies major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary study essentials, including basic concepts and methodological tools, to synthesize material from disparate fields and apply them to academic plans and career goals.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to diversity studies covering core topics of religion and spiritual traditions, race and ethnicities, gender and sexuality, and age and abilities.

IDS4602 - Reviving the Past: Researching.name: IDS4602 - Reviving the Past: Researching Lost Communities

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Researching lost, stolen, removed, & marginalized communities, students will be able to tell the story of the community’s past/present,  understand implications for future.
